O God! Thou art my God alone;

A song of yearning, soft and low,

When shadows stretch and hopes have flown,

O God, my God, be near, be known—
In Thee, forever, I am home.

O God! Thou art my God alone;
No other voice can claim my heart.
In wilderness and weary stone,
I seek the grace Thy hands impart.
Thy presence, morning's gentle fire,
Restores my spirit, lifts my song.

Leads me through shadows, sure and strong.
O God, my God, I trust Thy throne—
Forever, I am not my own.

When silence falls and night is long,
I call to Thee from earth unknown—
My refuge, fortress, and my song.

Only Your presence draws me near.
O God, my God, my soul has grown
To rest in Thee, and Thee alone.

O God! Thou art my God alone;
No other shelter can I claim.
Through storm and sun, through blood and bone,
Your holy love remains the same.
My soul, it thirsts for You, O King,

Each breath I take, each song I sing,
Returns me, Lord, again to You.
In every trial I have known,
O God, Thou art my God alone.

O God! Thou art my God alone;
In secret places, I implore

You hold me close through joys and harms;
Your steadfast love has proved me blessed.
O God, my God, my heart has grown
To worship You, and You alone.

Finding meaning in the silent field,

I told her that her two teams weren't playing,

Trading stories deep into the night.

I told her that her two teams weren't playing,

I told her that her two teams weren't playing,

And danced in the golden twilight.
No trophies, no medals, no roaring crowd—

I learned in that moment, the real victory
Is simply in being there.
